I hope we never forget your dedication to our nation, and I'll do whatever I can to make sure we don't. 
I recognize that so many of our veterans from a multitude of conflicts and deployments are enduring deep feelings about what's happening in Afghanistan right now.

To the service members who were deployed to Afghanistan, the Gold Star families who've lost a loved one while stationed there & those who supported a member of our military while they fought in that country ‚Äì nothing can shake the gratitude I feel for your service & sacrifice.

Now that the American presence has been removed from that country, the Biden White House needs to provide a realistic plan for how we're going to keep Afghanistan from backsliding into a dangerous threat to American citizens.
Our mission in Afghanistan was to root out the forces that made it a hub for terrorist activity. In that, we succeeded for two decades.

Pulling them out in this sloppy, haphazard public spectacle complete w/helicopter evacuations from the Kabul embassy has handed the Taliban a very public victory & created a dangerous vacuum being filled by terrorists who hate women, freedom, diversity, democracy & America.
Most of the roughly 2,500 troops still in Afghanistan were support personnel: intelligence specialists and special operations troops.

I‚Äôve met with Washington state troops and Afghani women leaders while in Afghanistan, and now I worry that their service and sacrifice has been set back or even erased. The truth is, we'd already pulled the vast majority of our forces out of the country years ago. 

Thread ‚¨áÔ∏è
